TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]装配工厂[COLOR_REVERT]是德国的特色建筑，替代[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]工厂[COLOR_REVERT]，可提升城市工业产能，但要以增加疾病点数为代价。[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]装配工厂[COLOR_REVERT]是建造 [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]火电站[COLOR_REVERT]、[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]水电站[COLOR_REVERT]或[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]核电站[COLOR_REVERT]的前提，在拥有相应资源的条件下进一步提升工业产能。

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Shale Plants[COLOR_REVERT], the Japanese replacements for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Coal Plants[COLOR_REVERT], provide power for the Factory, although the pollution will hurt your city's health.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]油页岩电站[COLOR_REVERT]是日本的特色建筑，替代[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]火电站[COLOR_REVERT]，可为工厂提供电力，但其造成的污染会影响城市的健康度。

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Madrassa[COLOR_REVERT], the Arabian replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Library[COLOR_REVERT] boost your cities' research and can provide a significant amount of culture if you have a state religion.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]伊斯兰学校[COLOR_REVERT]是阿拉伯的特色建筑，替代[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]图书馆[COLOR_REVERT]，可提升城市科研能力，如果拥有官方信仰还可提供大量文化点数。

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Seowon[COLOR_REVERT], the Korean replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]University[COLOR_REVERT], increases a city's research even more than a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]University[COLOR_REVERT] and provides culture.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]私塾[COLOR_REVERT]是高丽的特色建筑，替代[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]大学[COLOR_REVERT]，提升城市科研能力的作用比[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]大学[COLOR_REVERT]更强，并能提供文化点数。

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Salon[COLOR_REVERT], the French replacement for the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Observatory[COLOR_REVERT], increases a city's scientific research and increases the city's chances of generating a [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Great Artist[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]沙龙[COLOR_REVERT]是法国的特色建筑，替代[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]天文台[COLOR_REVERT]，可提升城市科研能力，并使能力更容易产生[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]大艺术家[COLOR_REVERT].

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Research Institutes[COLOR_REVERT], the Russian replacements for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Laboratories[COLOR_REVERT], provide a free scientist to their city in addition to increasing scientific research and spaceship production.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]研究所[COLOR_REVERT]是俄国的特色建筑，替代[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]实验室[COLOR_REVERT]，使所在城市可免费额外供养科学家，并提升科学研究和太空飞船建造速度。

TEXT.English: A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Pavillion[COLOR_REVERT], the Chinese replacement for a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Theatre[COLOR_REVERT], significantly increases a city's culture and increases the happiness output from using the culture slider.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]舞榭[COLOR_REVERT]是中国的特色建筑，替代[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]剧场[COLOR_REVERT]，可提供大量文化点数，并使文化支出（通过文化支出滑杆调节）产生更多的快乐点数。

TEXT.English: A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Odeon[COLOR_REVERT], the Greek replacement for a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Colosseum[COLOR_REVERT], increases a city's happiness even more than a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Colosseum[COLOR_REVERT], and also increases its happiness output from using the culture slider.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]露天剧场[COLOR_REVERT]是希腊的特色建筑，替代[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]竞技场[COLOR_REVERT]，提升城市快乐度的作用比[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]竞技场[COLOR_REVERT]更强，并使文化支出（通过文化支出滑杆调节）产生更多的快乐点数。

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Forums[COLOR_REVERT], the Roman replacements for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Markets[COLOR_REVERT], increase a city's wealth and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Great Person[COLOR_REVERT] birth rate. They also increase the city's happiness with access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Fur[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ivory[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Silk[COLOR_REVERT], or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Whales[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]中心广场[COLOR_REVERT]是罗马的特色建筑，替代[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]市场[COLOR_REVERT]，可增加城市财富积累以及 [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]历史伟人[COLOR_REVERT]的产生几率。在拥有[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]毛皮[COLOR_REVERT]、[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]象牙[COLOR_REVERT]、[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]丝绸[COLOR_REVERT]或[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]鲸鱼[COLOR_REVERT]的条件下还能额外提供快乐点数。

TEXT.English: An [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Apothecary[COLOR_REVERT], the Persian replacement for a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Grocer[COLOR_REVERT], increases a city's wealth and health. It further increases the city's health with access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Spices[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sugar[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Wine[COLOR_REVERT], or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Bananas[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]药剂店[COLOR_REVERT]是波斯的特色建筑，替代[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]杂货店[COLOR_REVERT]，可增加城市的财富积累和健康点数。在拥有[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]香料[COLOR_REVERT]、[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]食糖[COLOR_REVERT]、[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]酒类[COLOR_REVERT]或[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]香蕉[COLOR_REVERT]的条件下还能额外提供健康点数。

TEXT.English: A [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stock Exchange[COLOR_REVERT], the English replacement for a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bank[COLOR_REVERT], increases a city's production of wealth even more than a [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Bank[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]证券交易所[COLOR_REVERT]是英国的特色建筑，替代[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]银行[COLOR_REVERT]，增加城市的财富积累的作用比[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]银行[COLOR_REVERT]更强。

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Malls[COLOR_REVERT], the American replacement for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Supermarkets[COLOR_REVERT], increase the health of cities, especially if they have access to [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Deer[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cows[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pigs[COLOR_REVERT], or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sheep[COLOR_REVERT]. They also increase happiness from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hit Musicals[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hit Singles[COLOR_REVERT], and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hit Movies[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]购物中心[COLOR_REVERT]是美国的特色建筑，替代[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]超级市场[COLOR_REVERT]，可提升城市的健康度，有拥有[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]野鹿[COLOR_REVERT]、[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]牛群[COLOR_REVERT]、[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]家猪[COLOR_REVERT]或[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]绵羊[COLOR_REVERT]的条件下还能额外提供健康点数。并能增加[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]热门音乐剧[COLOR_REVERT]、[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]热门单曲[COLOR_REVERT]和[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]卖座电影[COLOR_REVERT]提升快乐度的能力。

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sacrificial Altars[COLOR_REVERT], the Aztec replacements for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Courthouses[COLOR_REVERT], lower city maintenance costs and reduce the anger duration from sacrificing population. [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Sacrificial Altars[COLOR_REVERT] help manage the cost of controlling large empires.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]人牲祭坛[COLOR_REVERT]是阿兹特克的特色建筑，替代[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]法庭[COLOR_REVERT]，可降低城市维护费，缩短牺牲人口加速建造所导致的不满持续的时间。[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]人牲祭坛[COLOR_REVERT]有助于控制广阔的帝国。

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Mausoleums[COLOR_REVERT], the Indian replacement for [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Jails[COLOR_REVERT], lower a city's [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]War Weariness[COLOR_REVERT] and provide happiness. Build them if you are involved in a long war and or if your citizens are generally starting to complain.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]陵墓[COLOR_REVERT]是印度的特色建筑，替代[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]监狱[COLOR_REVERT]，可减少城市的[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]厌战情绪[COLOR_REVERT]，增加快乐度。适宜在进行长期战争或市民感到不满的情况下建造。

TEXT.English: This powerful melee combat unit (the Celtic replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Swordsman[COLOR_REVERT]) is special because it starts with the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guerrilla I[COLOR_REVERT] promotion, making it a formidable defender on hills.
TEXT.Chinese: 高卢战士是凯尔特人特有的强大肉搏单位（替代[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]剑士[COLOR_REVERT]），该单位天然拥有[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]游击一级[COLOR_REVERT]晋升，非常适宜丘陵防御作战。

TEXT.English: This powerful melee combat unit (the Viking replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Maceman[COLOR_REVERT]) is special because it starts with the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Amphibious[COLOR_REVERT] promotion and is especially powerful when attacking cities.
TEXT.Chinese: 狂暴战士是维京人特有的强大肉搏单位（替代[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]钉锤手[COLOR_REVERT]），该单位天然拥有[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]两栖作战[COLOR_REVERT]晋升，非常适宜攻击城市。

TEXT.English: This powerful melee combat unit (the Zulu replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Spearman[COLOR_REVERT]) is special because in addition to its strength against mounted units it starts with the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mobility[COLOR_REVERT] promotion.
TEXT.Chinese: 祖鲁矛兵是祖鲁人特有的强大肉搏单位（替代[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]矛兵[COLOR_REVERT]），该单位天然拥有[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]机动能力[COLOR_REVERT]晋升，非常适宜对抗骑乘单位。

TEXT.English: This early gunpowder combat unit (the Ottoman replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Musketman[COLOR_REVERT]) is special because it is especially strong against melee, archer, and mounted units.
TEXT.Chinese: 苏丹亲兵是奥斯曼人特有的早期火器单位（替代[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]火枪手[COLOR_REVERT]），该单位非常适宜对抗肉搏、投射类以及骑乘类单位。

TEXT.English: This mounted combat unit (the Carthaginian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Horse Archer[COLOR_REVERT]) is especially effective against melee units and has a high chance to withdraw from battle when it's losing. It is an excellent counter to enemy catapults.
TEXT.Chinese: 努米底亚骑兵是迦太基人特有的骑乘单位（替代[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]骑射手[COLOR_REVERT]），该单位非常适宜对抗肉搏单位和投石车，并具有较高的撤退几率。

TEXT.English: A [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Trebuchet[COLOR_REVERT] is especially effective when assaulting cities, can bombard enemy city fortifications, and has a chance to withdraw from combat when losing. When attacking another unit, they cause collateral damage to other enemy units sharing the target's space.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]抛石机[COLOR_REVERT]非常适宜进行攻城战，能够快速破坏城防，并具有较高的撤退几率。进行直接攻击时能对同一地块的其他敌方单位造成附带伤害。

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Triremes[COLOR_REVERT] are especially effective in combat against [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galleys[COLOR_REVERT], but they have no transport capacity. They cannot enter ocean spaces.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]三层桨战船[COLOR_REVERT]非常适宜对抗[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]桨帆船[COLOR_REVERT]，但是没有运载能力，无法进入大洋。

TEXT.English: The Norse sagas are stories about Scandinavian history and folklore. The oldest were preserved for ages through an oral tradition before finally being written down towards the end of the medieval period. Sometimes the tales are realistic; sometimes they are clearly legendary and fantastic. Sagas served as both the formal history of the Viking kings and also the mythical stories of famous heroes. The world of the sagas is strongly pagan. Fate - a dominant concept in the pre-Christian Norse religion - often plays a central role in these tales. [PARAGRAPH:2]Sagas are epic tales in prose, often with stanzas or whole poems in alliterative verse embedded within them. The style tends to be impersonal, providing only terse details with no explanation of "why" - things simply happen, and no one questions Fate. Characters are only briefly introduced, with a few simple adjectives serving to show their personality ("brave warrior", "powerful king", etc.) Relationships between characters are complex. Heroes often have to overcome seemingly impossible tasks; life is generally short and cruel; and the only thing worth pursuing is honor and glory, gained through feats of arms. Any slight or insult to someone's honor has to be avenged, in blood or money. Often the world of the supernatural played a role in the sagas, and figures from the Norse religion could figure prominently. [PARAGRAPH:2]The Kings' Sagas are a group of specific Norse sagas that describe the lives of Scandinavian kings. They were written down between the twelfth and fourteenth centuries after the Vikings had converted to Christianity. These writings are the closest thing that exists to a history of the Scandinavians during the pre-Christian Viking Age, and they have been of inestimable value to historians who study the period. [PARAGRAPH:2]The saga is not strictly a Norse literary technique, and other cultures have produced works similar in form and tone. The epics of Homer, the samurai legends of Japan, and even the cowboy tales of the American West are examples of such works. [PARAGRAPH:2]
TEXT.Chinese: 北欧传奇（saga）是有关斯堪的纳维亚历史和神话传说的故事。最古老的北欧传奇是通过口头方式一代代地流传，最终在中世纪晚期成为书面文献。这些传奇有的具有相当的现实性；有的则充满奇幻色彩。北欧传奇的主题有维京王公们的历史，也有著名神话英雄的业绩。北欧传奇的世界受到原始宗教的强烈影响。命运——这是基督教传入之前北欧原始信仰的最重要概念——在北欧传奇中起着最主导的作用。[PARAGRAPH:2]北欧传奇通常采用散文体，往往分成许多小节，其中也可能包含多篇头韵体诗歌。其内容倾向于客观地叙述，简洁地描写，而不多加解释——事情就那样发生了，不用问为什么。人物简简单单地出场，对其性格只用几个形容词加以描述（“勇敢的战士”、“强大的国王”等等）。人物之间的关系则错综复杂。英雄人物必须完成看起来几乎不可能的任务；人物的一生往往短暂而残酷；唯一值得追求的东西只有声望和荣誉，这些东西需要使用力量和技艺去获取。对个人荣誉最轻微的冒犯也必须加以报复，或是用鲜血，或是用金钱。超自然的力量在北欧传奇经常出现，北欧神话中的神灵往往会亲自出场。[PARAGRAPH:2]“国王传奇”是一种特殊类型的北欧传奇，内容是描写某位斯堪的纳维国王的一生。古老的国王传奇在12至14世纪成为书面文献，当时的维京人已经皈依了基督教。这些文献可以被视为是维京时代斯堪的纳维亚的历史记录，对研究这一时代的历史学家来说具有无法估量的价值。[PARAGRAPH:2]“传奇”本身并不是北欧独有的文学形式，其他文化族群也有类似的作品诞生。例如古希腊的荷马史诗，日本的武士传奇，甚至美国的西部牛仔故事等等。[PARAGRAPH:2]

TEXT.English: No War Weariness and extra production from Mines and Workshops. For the warmonger whose focus is solely on the battlefield and wants to spend as little time as possible worrying about what's happening at home.
TEXT.Chinese: 消除厌战情绪，矿井和工场提供额外工业产出。适于那些只专注与军事、不愿顾及内部问题的战争狂。

TEXT.English: Press F4 to purchase units and promotions.
[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Shipyards[COLOR_REVERT] provide your ships with additional experience and increase your cities cultural output slightly.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]船厂[COLOR_REVERT]可为舰船提供额外经验点数，并可增加城市文化积累。

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]King's Saga[COLOR_REVERT] increases your production of Great People.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]国王传奇[COLOR_REVERT]可提升历史伟人出现几率。

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Legendary Saga[COLOR_REVERT] increases your production of military units.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]冒险传奇[COLOR_REVERT]可加快军事单位组建速度。

TEXT.English: You may purchase a galley for free if you do not have any naval units. This prevents you from becoming trapped on an island. Galley's have a transport capacity of 5 units and can move across oceans.
TEXT.Chinese: 如果你还没有任何海上单位，将可免费获得一艘桨帆船。这样就不至于被困在一个小岛上。桨帆船可以运载5个单位，并能在大洋中航行。

TEXT.English: Use this missionary to actively spread [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hellenism[COLOR_REVERT] in friendly cities (or rival cities with whom you have [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Open Borders[COLOR_REVERT]).
TEXT.Chinese: 使用此类单位在本国城市（或签有[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]开放边界[COLOR_REVERT]条约的别国城市）传播[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]希腊文化[COLOR_REVERT]。

TEXT.English: This is a superior version of the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Spearman[COLOR_REVERT].

This powerful melee combat unit gets a bonus against mounted units and is adept at hill defense. It is superior to the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Spearman[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Hoplite[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Chinese: 这种强大的肉搏单位在对抗骑乘单位时可获得战斗力奖励加成，适宜防御丘陵地带。该单位战斗力比[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]矛兵[COLOR_REVERT]和[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]重装矛兵[COLOR_REVERT]更强。

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Trireme[COLOR_REVERT] cannot carry military units, but it is faster and more powerful than the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galley[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]三层桨战船[COLOR_REVERT]不能运载陆上单位，但航速和战斗力比[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]桨帆船[COLOR_REVERT]更优越。

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Plato's Academy[COLOR_REVERT] greatly increase a city's scientific research as well as its cultural output.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]柏拉图学园[COLOR_REVERT]可大大提升城市科研能力，增加文化点数。

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]High Walls[COLOR_REVERT] increase your city's defenses aganst pre-gunpowder units. Build them in cities near enemy civilizations.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]大型城墙[COLOR_REVERT]可提升城市对冷兵器时代单位的防御能力。适宜在邻近敌国的城市建造。

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Military Encampment[COLOR_REVERT] grants additional experience points to troops built in their cities. Build them in all cities that will produce military units.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]军事宿营地[COLOR_REVERT]可为所在城市新组建单位提供额外经验点数。适宜在需要组建军事单位的城市建造。

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Agoras[COLOR_REVERT] are ancient Greek [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Markets[COLOR_REVERT]. They increase a city's wealth.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]希腊集市[COLOR_REVERT]是古希腊城市的[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]市场[COLOR_REVERT]。可增加城市财富积累。

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Theatre of Dionysus[COLOR_REVERT] increases a city's cultural output. It allows you to turn 3 citizens into Artists, and it increases the city's chances of generating a [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Artist[COLOR_REVERT].
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]酒神剧场[COLOR_REVERT]可提升城市的文化点数。允许将3单位市民转化为艺术家，并能增加城市产生[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]大艺术家[COLOR_REVERT]的几率。

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Odeon[COLOR_REVERT] increases a city's cultural output and its happiness. It allows you to turn 2 citizens into Artists.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]露天剧场[COLOR_REVERT]可提升城市的文化点数及快乐度。允许将2单位市民转化为艺术家。

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Temples[COLOR_REVERT] increase a city's happiness and culture. They are especially useful for expanding your civilization's borders during the early game.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]神庙[COLOR_REVERT]可提升城市的快乐度及文化点数。适宜在早期扩张文明的边界。

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Monasteries[COLOR_REVERT] allow you to create [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Missionaries[COLOR_REVERT], who can spread the faith in other cities. They also provide culture and a slight boost to research.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]隐修院[COLOR_REVERT]使城市可以训练[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]祭司[COLOR_REVERT]，向其他城市传播信仰。并能增加文化及科研点数。

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Hellenic Cathedral[COLOR_REVERT] greatly increases a city's cultural output. It makes a city's citizens happy (if [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Hellenism[COLOR_REVERT] is the state religion).
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]希腊大神庙[COLOR_REVERT]可大大提升城市文化点数。并提升城市快乐度（如果[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]希腊文化[COLOR_REVERT]是你的官方信仰）。

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Senate Buildings[COLOR_REVERT] lower city maintenance costs and are required to build the [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Forbidden Palace[COLOR_REVERT] national wonder. They help manage the cost of controlling large empires.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]城邦议会[COLOR_REVERT]可减少城市维护费，还是建造国家级奇观[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]紫禁城[COLOR_REVERT]的前提，有助于维持一个大帝国。
埃吉尔·斯卡拉格里姆松
研究此项以训练工程师

TEXT.English: To win you must destroy Civilization.
TEXT.Chinese: 要获得胜利必须摧毁文明.

TEXT.English: The objective of this scenario is to destroy Civilization. You will select the number of turns you wish to allow the game to autoplay. After the autoplay finishes, you will be taken to the Barbarian Horde screen. Use the Barbarian Horde Screen (F4) to purchase units and promotions. As you pillage, fight, and conquer civilization you will gain treasure which you can use to buy more units and promotions. You win once you have conquered all of the civilizations.
TEXT.Chinese: 本剧情的目标是摧毁文明。你将选择希望游戏先自动进行多少个回合数，自动进行回合数完成后，你将进入蛮族部落界面。使用蛮族部落界面（F4）购买单位和晋升。通过劫掠、战斗和征服文明世界，你可以获得大笔财富以继续购买单位和晋升。征服所有文明之后即赢得胜利。

TEXT.English: Athens is one of the great cities in world history. In ancient times its citizens made great contributions to many areas of politics, culture, and learning - including the virtual invention of philosophy, drama, science, and democracy. It can be argued that Athens has had the greatest influence of any city, state or empire on what is called, "Western Civilization." [PARAGRAPH:1]Humans have lived on the site of Athens since the Neolithic period (circa 4000 BC). According to tradition, the city-state (or "polis") of Athens was ruled by kings until roughly 1000 BC, after which it was governed by officials known as "archons," who were drawn from the ruling aristocracy. At first there were three archons, but six more were added later, bringing the total number of rulers to nine. Although originally reserved for the powerful ruling class, as time passed these offices were opened up to commoners. [PARAGRAPH:1]One archon, Solon, is credited with creating the famed Athenian democracy. Beginning in 594 BC, Solon implemented a series of liberal reforms that abolished serfdom, modified some of Athens' harsher laws, and removed some of the political restrictions on the city's economy. His reforms were so popular that Solon was subsequently given the task of rewriting Athens' constitution. While doing so, Solon significantly liberalized the Athenian government. creating a limited democracy which for the first time gave power to the non-aristocratic propertied classes. Throughout this period Athens continued to prosper and grow in size and influence. [PARAGRAPH:1]Some thirty years later, Athens' government was overthrown in a coup by a man named "Pisistratus." Though keeping many of Solon's reforms, Pisistratus ruled as a "tyrant," reserving the city-state's highest offices for friends and family. Pisistratus and his sons ruled Athens from 560-511 BC, until they were overthrown in turn by Cleisthenes, who restored Athens' limited democracy. Cleisthenes then expanded the democracy further, allowing all free Athenian men to participate in the government. Although women and slaves were still excluded from power, this was the most liberal - even radical - form of government yet seen in the world. [PARAGRAPH:1]In classical Athenian democracy, anyone (excluding women and slaves) was free to vote or serve a term in office. Most officials were chosen by lot, and government positions were rotated frequently. This was not always the most effective form of government, as it was quite common for people with no training whatsoever to find themselves elevated to positions of power and prestige, but under it the city-state thrived. [PARAGRAPH:1]As of 500 BC, much of Greece was thriving, and there were a number of successful city-states competing with Athens for primacy of the region. It wasn't until the Persian Wars of that century that Athens rose to preeminence. Athenian hoplites first fought and defeated a much larger Persian army at the Battle of Marathon in 492 BC. When the Persians returned a decade later with a much larger army, the united Greek armies were unable to halt the Persians' advance upon Athens. At the famous battle of Thermopylae, however, 300 Spartans sacrificed their lives to slow the Persians enough to allow the Athenians to evacuate their city, which the Persians subsequently entered and burned. [PARAGRAPH:1]Despite this grievous loss, the Athenian navy held firm, defeating the Persians at the Battle of Salamis in 480 BC. The combined Greek forces subsequently destroyed the invading armies and navies. As the war progressed Athens put together a loose confederation of polis, including most of the important island-based city-states, called the "Delian League," which brought the fight into Persia itself, eventually gaining the freedom of several important Greek colonies on the coast of Asia Minor and nearby islands. When the war ended the citizens of Athens returned to their city, and over the next years rebuilt it stronger and grander than ever before. In the following decades Athens became the cultural center of the Greek world. This was the golden age of the classical Athenian democracy, the era of famous figures such as Herodotus, Aeschylus, Sophocles, Euripides, and Socrates. [PARAGRAPH:1]During this period Athens became the dominant city-state in Greece. It possessed a lucrative trading empire, which was protected by its powerful navy, and it gradually transformed the Delian League into an empire, the other city-states in the League required to pay Athens tribute. This alarmed many of the other Greek polis, which, under the leadership of Sparta - the greatest land power in Greece - banded together in the "Spartan Alliance" to counter Athens' growing might. [PARAGRAPH:1]In 431 BC war broke out between the Delian League and the Spartan Alliance. commanded by Pericles, Athens' greatest statesman and general, Athens won numerous victories, but was unable to ever deliver the knockout blow needed to force the Spartans to surrender. Upon Pericles' death - from a plague that badly weakened Athens - command of the Athenian government and armed forces fell to less able hands, and the Athenians found themselves in a thirty-year war of attrition which grew ever more bitter and bloody as the years passed. [PARAGRAPH:1]Protected from direct assault by its Long Walls, and supplied by its offshore empire (inaccessible to the enemy), Athens survived the long war in fairly good shape (though its democratic institutions were gradually undermined). It is quite possible that Athens could have eventually forced its opponents into peace, if her people hadn't decided to send off a large portion of Athens' military forces on a foolish adventure of conquest to Sicily in 415 BC. During the campaign the Athenian army was obliterated, and its navy destroyed in detail. Though Athens continued to resist for some ten years, its defeat was inevitable. Athens finally surrendered to Sparta in 404 BC, its fleet in shambles and its overseas empire destroyed. [PARAGRAPH:1]Although Athens was able to recover briefly in the following decades, its golden age was past and it would never again reach the heights it attained before the disastrous war with Sparta. In 338 BC, Athens (along with the rest of Greece) was conquered by Philip of Macedon. The city would never again see independence, and Greece would spend most of the next 2,000 years under foreign rule - governed in turn by Macedonia, Rome, Byzantium, and the Ottoman Empire. In 1829 AD Greece would finally win independence - and Athens was naturally chosen as the new state's capital city.
TEXT.Chinese: 雅典可以说是世界历史上最伟大的城市之一。远古时代的雅典居民在政治、文化和学术等各个领域取得了无数的成就，为人类文明作出了巨大的贡献——他们最先创立了哲学、戏剧、自然科学和民主制度。据认为雅典对“西方文明”的影响超过任何其他城市、国家或是世界性帝国。[PARAGRAPH:1]雅典地区在新石器时代即有人居住（约公元前4000年）。据传说，雅典城邦（"polis"）最初是由世袭国王所统治，直到约公元前1000年，此后的雅典改由从豪门贵族中选拔的“执政官”（archon）行使统治权。起初是三名执政官，后来又增加了六名，达到九人之多。最初的执政官只是从贵族统治阶层中产生，随着时间的推移，这些职位也开始向普通民众开放。[PARAGRAPH:1]执政官梭伦被认为是雅典式民主制度的创立者。在公元前594年梭伦开始实行一系列的自由化改革，废除农奴制，修改部分严苛的法律，并取消了许多对城市经济活动的行政限制。他的改革措施获得了广泛的欢迎，随后梭伦又受命重新编撰雅典宪法。在修订宪法的过程中，梭伦显著增加了雅典的政治自由度。他建立了有限的民主制度，首度赋予非贵族的有产阶级以参政权。在这一时期，雅典经济日趋繁荣，城市规模及影响力不断扩大。[PARAGRAPH:1]大约三十年后，雅典政府被一场政变所推翻，政变的策动者是皮西特拉图斯（Pisistratus），虽然梭伦改革的许多成果被保留下来，皮西特拉图斯的统治仍类似于“暴君”，他将城邦的高级职位都委任给自己的亲戚朋友。皮西特拉图斯及其后代在前560-前511年间持续统治雅典，最终被克利斯提尼斯所推翻，此人恢复了雅典的有限民主制，并进一步加以推广，赋予所有雅典自由人以参政权。虽然妇女和奴隶仍然被排除在外，但在当时及以后很长一段时期内都是全世界最自由（甚至可以说是激进）的政治体制。[PARAGRAPH:1]在雅典的民主制下，任何人（妇女与奴隶除外）都有权参加投票选举或担任政府官职。多数政府官员通过抽签产生，并定期轮换。这样的政府并不总是最有效率的政府，而且往往会使得没有足够能力和经验的人身居高位，但它毕竟使得城邦保持了繁荣的状态。[PARAGRAPH:1]在公元前500年的时候，希腊大部分地区均和平安定，有许多其他城邦开始兴起，与雅典争夺地区主导权。直到随后爆发的希波战争期间，雅典才真正确立其领袖地位。雅典的重装矛兵在公元前492年的马拉松战役中击败了占据人数优势的波斯军队。十年之后波斯人卷土重来，发动更大规模的入侵，希腊联军无法阻挡波斯人向雅典的挺进。不过在著名的温泉关战役中，300斯巴达战士奋勇抵抗，牺牲自己以使雅典居民能够及时疏散，波斯人只得到一座空城，并将其付之一炬。[PARAGRAPH:1]虽然遭遇这样的惨败，雅典海军仍坚持战斗，公元前480年，他们在萨拉米斯湾海战中大败波斯海军。重新组织起来的希腊联军最终消灭了波斯入侵者。在战争期间，雅典人组建了一个包括大部分重要爱琴海岛屿的松散的城邦同盟，称为“提洛同盟”，同盟军队对波斯本土发动反攻，在爱琴海东岸诸岛及小亚细亚建立了一系列希腊殖民地。当战争结束时，雅典居民返回自己的城市，开始重建家园，仅数年时间就将雅典建设得更加辉煌壮丽。此后数十年，雅典成为整个希腊化世界的文化中心。这是雅典民主制的黄金时代，涌现出一大批影响深远的历史伟人，例如希罗多德、埃斯库罗斯、索福克勒斯、欧里庇得斯、苏格拉底等等等等。[PARAGRAPH:1]在这一时期，雅典城邦在全希腊处于支配地位。她掌控着一个获利丰厚的贸易网络、并以一支强大的海军为其后盾，提洛同盟在某种意义上逐渐转变为“邪典帝国”，同盟中的其他城邦需要向雅典缴纳贡礼。雅典的强盛令其他希腊城邦感到不安，他们在拥有全希腊最强陆军的斯巴达主导下建立起一个“斯巴达同盟”，与雅典进行对抗。[PARAGRAPH:1]公元前431年，提洛同盟与斯巴达同盟的战争终于爆发了。战争初期，雅典在伟大的政治家和军事家伯里克利的领导下赢得了无数胜利，可是仍未能迫使斯巴达人投降。在伯里克利因一场席卷雅典的大瘟疫而去世之后（这场瘟疫严重削弱了雅典的实力），雅典政府和军队的后任领导者均缺乏足够的能力，残酷血腥的战争持续了三十年。[PARAGRAPH:1]在高大的城墙及来自海上的补给（斯巴达人对海洋无能为力）的支持下，雅典仍能在战争中保持不败（虽然其民主体制已开始遭到破坏）。如果不是因为公元前415年愚蠢地决定派遣大军对西西里岛进行远征，雅典人有很大的机会迫使敌人接受和平。雅典陆军在这场战役中完全覆没，海军也损失惨重。此后雅典仍坚持了十余年，但失败已不可避免。公元前404年，雅典向斯巴达投降，她的战舰被拆毁，她的海外领地也全部丧失。[PARAGRAPH:1]战败的雅典经过数十年重建得以重振旗鼓，但其黄金时代已经结束，经过这场可怕的战争，雅典再也无法恢复其巅峰时代的强盛状态了。公元前338年，雅典同其他希腊城邦被马其顿国王腓力二世征服，永远丧失了独立地位，希腊在此后2,000年的大部分时间里处于外来政权的统治之下——马其顿帝国、罗马帝国、拜占庭帝国、奥斯曼帝国。1829年，希腊终于赢得独立——雅典自然而然地成为这个新国家的首都。

TEXT.English: Use this missionary to actively spread [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Religion[COLOR_REVERT] in friendly cities (or rival cities with whom you have [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Open Borders[COLOR_REVERT]).
TEXT.Chinese: 使用此类单位在本国城市（或签有[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]开放边界[COLOR_REVERT]条约的别国城市）传播[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]宗教信仰[COLOR_REVERT]。

TEXT.English: All players must choose a unique leader for anonymous play
TEXT.Chinese: 匿名游戏时所有玩家必须选择一个领袖名字
弗雷迪斯·埃里克斯多特
要获得胜利你需要积累%d1_Num金币.

TEXT.English: The "Title" civic is a game mechanic that is used to track Alexander's legendary status. As the unit Alexander is attached to gains levels, Alexander will gain better "Titles." The better Alexander's "Title", the easier it will be to rule a large nation. [PARAGRAPH:1]If the unit Alexander is attached to should ever die, Alexander's "Title" will revert back the worst title until Alexander has healed from his wounds and is reattached to a unit.
TEXT.Chinese: “头衔称号”是用来表现亚历山大声望的增长。随着亚历山大战斗的胜利和等级的提升，他将获得更好的“称号”，“称号”越高，统治大帝国的能力就越强。[PARAGRAPH:1]如果亚历山大直接指挥的单位被消灭，他的“称号”将会降至最低一级，直到亚历山大伤愈复出再度指挥部队。

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Macedonian Barracks[COLOR_REVERT] provide the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Flanking I[COLOR_REVERT] promotion to units built in this city. In addition [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mounted Units[COLOR_REVERT] will receive +2 experience points.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]马其顿兵营[COLOR_REVERT]可使所在城市新组建单位获得[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]迂回一级[COLOR_REVERT]晋升。并使[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]骑乘单位[COLOR_REVERT]经验点数+2。

TEXT.English: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Athian Barracks[COLOR_REVERT] provide the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Flanking I[COLOR_REVERT] promotion to units built in this city.
TEXT.Chinese: [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]雅典兵营[COLOR_REVERT]可使所在城市新组建单位获得[COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]迂回一级[COLOR_REVERT]晋升。

贾拉鲁丁·穆罕默德·阿克巴

TEXT.English: Sited around the Ohio River, vacant of humanity for nearly 100 years and thus densely populated with game, tensions between New France and Britain are escalating. Between this approaching storm, nearly 3,000 Shawnee and Lenape Indians have found commercial success in trading fur for weapons and other goods.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]While the unfolding events may differ from historical ones, as Governor of New France or an investigating 21 year old Major of the British military, your actions will be one of the many factors which ignite a massive international conflict.
TEXT.Chinese: 俄亥俄河两岸在过去一百年里少人居住，此时却随着法国和英国移民的到来而日益繁荣，双方的对立情绪也使形势逐渐紧张，一场风暴随时可能发生。与此同时当地还有3,000名肖尼族和勒纳佩族原住民，他们以毛皮同新移民交换武器和其他物资。[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]在游戏里，事态的发展也许会和历史完全不同，是扮演那位“新法兰西”殖民地的总督，还是扮演那位年仅21岁、前途无量的英军少校，你的决定将改变那一场国际冲突的历史走向。

TEXT.English: Player %d1_ID has logging enabled.[NEWLINE]Verify that this is a trusted player.
TEXT.Chinese: 玩家 %d1_ID 启用了日志记录.[NEWLINE]请确定对方是可依赖的玩家.
